title: Enhancing Organizational Development Practical Competencies: VR/MR-Based Instructional Design Workshop for Future Teachers' Creativity Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Educational Technology Knowledge and Secondary Curriculum Comprehension
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for Corporate Management/HR Professionals

learning_goals: Develop ≥3 instructional design scenarios balancing creativity-promoting factors (immersion, attention, relaxation) in VR/MR environments

Learners can select one social studies topic (history/civic education) using a 3D simulation tool (e.g., Minecraft Education Edition, Unity-based platform) implemented in a Mixed Reality (MR) environment and design a creative instructional model with three or more phases (introduction-development-conclusion). The model must achieve an 80% or higher suitability rating in peer and expert reviews.

Learners can select three case studies of VR/MR technology-based lesson designs and write a five-page evaluation report comparing their effectiveness (learning immersion, interactivity) and limitations (technical constraints, cost issues). The report must include at least five APA-formatted references.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
